column4: I use Windows sometimes just for video games, and even though I never use a web browser, the os seems to corrupt and break itself down over time.
ah, must have missed whatever you were talking about, just joined the channel
Mac OS X is great for catholics.
As long as you listen to Apple and do what Apple says, you're computer will work fine
!ubottu | ikonia
I know how it works, thanks
just ignore it
please stop feeding it
that kernel hasn't been released for ubuntu
yeah I know, but is there a way to make my broadcom chipset work anyway?
you've just broke compatability, and using an unsupported kernel, you should have an idea of how to get these things workiung
why did you update the kernel ?
why did you think updating the kernel to an unsupported kernel would fix these random issues
what made you think they are kernel related problems
yes, 3.3.6 was the fix he suggested
you appear to have used a totally different and random kernel branch
and looking at that bug report, it's random people offering random advice, some usint nvidia, some using intel etc, there doesn't appear to be much logic behind it from what I'm reading
yes, and he suggested a tottally different kernel than the one you've used
I just installed kernel 3.3.6, restarted into that kernel. I had the same exact problem I had in 3.4.4 in the exact same way
again, that's not an official kernel
